thorwin.math.geo

Class GeodeticBounds

  • java.lang.Object
    • thorwin.math.geo.GeodeticBounds
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class GeodeticBounds
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Bounds of a rectangular area in geodetic coordinates (may multiply anti-meridian by defining the eastern border to the left of the western border).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeodeticBounds

        public GeodeticBounds(double south,
                      double west,
                      double north,
                      double east)
        Constructs a new GeodeticBounds instance. Note that if the south-boundary is specified to be north of the north-boundary, both boundaries are automatically corrected.
        Parameters:
        south - south
        west - west
        north - north
        east - west

      • GeodeticBounds

        public GeodeticBounds(Geodetic southWest,
                      Geodetic northEast)
        Constructs a new GeodeticBounds instance. Note that if south-west-boundary is specified to be to the north of the north-east-boundary, the north and south bounds are automatically corrected.
        Parameters:
        southWest - southwest bounds
        northEast - northeast bounds

    • Method Detail

      • getCenter

        public Geodetic getCenter()
        Return the center of the bounds
        Returns:
        the center of the bounds.

      • union

        public GeodeticBounds union(GeodeticBounds other)
        Creates a union of this bounds and the other. The union is the smallest extent that contains both bounds.
        Parameters:
        other - other geodetic bounds
        Returns:
        union of the bounds

      • extend

        public GeodeticBounds extend(Geodetic location)
        Extends the bounds to contain the specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - location to extend
        Returns:
        union of the bounds

        Returns:
        true if the specific coordinate is contained within the bounds.

        public double getLongitudeExtent()
        Returns the longitude extent
        Returns:
        The width of the bounds (in range [0,2PI<).

      • contains

        public boolean contains(double latitude,
                        double longitude)
        Determines if a geodetic coordinate is contained within these bounds
        Parameters:
        latitude - latitude (in radians)
        longitude - longitude (in radians)
        Returns:
        true if the specific coordinate is contained within the bounds.

      • isOverAntiMeridian

        public boolean isOverAntiMeridian()
        Returns true if the bounds fall over the anti-meridian
        Returns:
        true if the longitude of the east is actually smaller than the west.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(GeodeticBounds other)
        Determine if other bounds are contained within these bounds
        Parameters:
        other - other bounds
        Returns:
        true if the bounds are contained within this bounds.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • subdivide

        public GeodeticBounds[] subdivide(int iterations)
        Subdivides the bounds in four parts, along the center, in multiple iterations.
        Parameters:
        iterations - number of iterations to perform
        Returns:
        an array of pow(4, iterations) geodetic bounds.
